235.words: So actually I think about this a lot because I feel like often there's a sense of feeling trapped because there are not only just so many distractions around us, but responsibilities. Would you walk away from this job? Do you even have that option to walk away from this job because it's getting to a point that's hard to bear? And yet the resources are so limited. So something on the mental health space that I saw first-hand is, again, as a society, we're very readily prescribed medication as opposed to invest in the community care support structures that might be more beneficial long term. And so to me that's really the question, is what are we doing in terms of our priorities and values? If you ask people, everybody wants to be cared for. Everybody wants that sort of support. Yet as Social Workers, as mental health care workers, I think we're also familiar that the investment that's needed is just not there. And I think time is part of it because people are looking for shortcuts. People are looking for ways to quickly make the big bucks.
